##Liu Qiao: anti-epidemic is a great test of local governance ability

I-CAIJING

CAIJING magazine official Wechat. "CAIJING" magazine, sponsored by the China Securities Market Research Center, was first published in 1998, adhering to the news concept of "independence, exclusiveness and originality" , and is known for authoritative, impartial and professional reporting, it is a must-read publication for policy-makers, researchers and managers in the field of politics and economics.

The outbreak could be a turning point as governments at all levels shift from a "growth tournament" to a new performance evaluation framework that focuses on governance capabilities and governance systems. How to improve the ability and resilience of the market to deal with emergencies is also an important indicator of the improvement of the country's comprehensive governance capacity

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
On February 12,2020, the Shelter Hospital at Wuhan Sports Center Stadium opened, providing 1,100 beds for patients with mild cases of new pneumonia. Chen Liying (left) from the Anhui Medical Team and colleagues wait at the door for patients to be transferred. Photo / Xinhua

By Wang Yanchun, CAIJING correspondent

Editor | Susie

On January 23, Wuhan was "sealed off" . The next day, a number of provinces and cities launched a major public health emergency response level, a number of places "closed people, closed city, open road, road closure. ". Even in some places there is a "one-size-fits-all, layer upon layer plus, more than too much" phenomenon. Some cities with mild epidemic situation imitate the measures taken in the areas with serious epidemic situation and adopt various kinds of excessive restrictions to enlarge the "wound area" of the economy. For example, the flow of people frozen, logistics, blocked return, delayed resumption of work.

On February 3rd a meeting of the Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China stressed that, in the work of epidemic prevention and control, we must firmly hold the government accountable for its opposition to formalism and bureaucratism, its unwillingness to take responsibility, its work style drifting, and its prevarication. The outbreak is a test for China's governance system, he said. On February 12, the Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China said that non epidemic prevention and control key areas should focus on the implementation of precise prevention and control by zoning, classification, and coordination of epidemic prevention and control and the restoration of economic and social order.

Liu Qiao, president of the Guanghua School of Management, told a CAIJING reporter that public crisis emergency management should not be "single-dimensional" guidance. Two dimensions need to be emphasized. The first is to prevent the spread of the epidemic. The second is to resume production and employment as far as possible, and to take a scientific and reasonable way to enable workers to return to work. "local authorities should avoid excessive intervention, adopt policies that go too far, respect market rules and gradually resume market activities. Beware of the knock-on effects of excessive practices such as the unlimited expansion of segregated groups. "

Liu Qiao believes that, "The governance capability of local governments determines the level of modernization of National Governance System and governance capability. At present, China's government performance evaluation has formed a new performance evaluation framework. To enhance the ability and resilience of the market to respond to emergencies is also an important sign of the country's improving comprehensive governance capacity."2020 is destined to be the year of the government's big test, it is urgent to pay close attention to and ponder over the shortcomings and shortcomings in the aspects of epidemic situation cognitive prediction, crisis management, emergency management and social management.

Overall consideration should be given to the prevention and control of epidemic situation and resumption of work and production

CAIJING: At the beginning of 2020, the sudden outbreak of COVID-19 pneumonia spread across the country, and various measures were put in place to deal with it, including traffic control, business closures and extended holidays. How do you judge the economic impact of the outbreak?

Liu Qiao: When many scholars discuss the impact of the epidemic on the economy, they are talking about the impact on the gross domestic product (GDP) , and they tend to compare the economic impact of the epidemic with that of Atypical pneumonia in 2003, but my personal feeling is that there are many differences between the two, and that this simple analogy may itself be answering the wrong question. These differences can be seen in three ways.

First, the underlying logic of economic growth has changed. high-speed growth, previously driven by investment, is now driven by consumption and efficiency, and growth has slowed.

Second, our industrial structure and growth momentum have also changed a lot. In addition to fixed asset investment, consumption has become the most important driver of China's economic growth.

Third, the timing of the outbreak, which took place during the Spring Festival, and the large-scale outbreak of SARS after the Spring Festival, was different, with different structural effects.

In 2019, for example, our industrial structure accounted for 54% of GDP and nearly 60% of GDP growth, compared with tertiary sector of the economy. In other words, the tertiary sector of the economy, often referred to as the service sector, has become a major pillar of the Chinese economy and a driving force for growth. Compared with other industries, the impact of this epidemic on the service sector is actually the biggest and most direct. Transportation, storage, wholesale and retail, accommodation, catering, entertainment and other offline services have been hit hard, and these sectors, along with agriculture, forestry, fish and animal husbandry, have also been hit hard, together accounting for 36% of GDP. Therefore, we need to make a specific analysis of the impact of the specific industries, to take appropriate economic measures, it is possible to assess the impact of the epidemic on the Chinese economy in the end what kind of impact.

The economic impact of the virus outbreak is an endogenous variable for two reasons: First, the extent of the impact itself depends on the control of the epidemic. At this stage, it may have a big impact on consumption and tertiary sector of the economy, but it will soon spread to manufacturing, real estate, import and export related industries, and even other industries. So it's important to get it under control as soon as possible. Second, the extent of the impact depends on how we respond to the impact of the epidemic. If we can identify the main areas where the impact of the epidemic is relatively large, and therefore take some targeted policy measures to reduce the impact.

My personal judgment is that compared with 2003 SARS, the impact of this epidemic is more reflected in two aspects, one is the impact of micro, small and medium-sized enterprises, and the other is the impact of employment. And now China's small and medium-sized enterprises basically solve more than 80% of the employment, from this point of view, the two issues are actually combined, that is, now the top priority is to help small and medium-sized enterprises to tide over the difficulties.

CAIJING: What is the biggest challenge faced by small and medium-sized enterprises?

Liu Qiao: As the main body of the private economy, the small and medium-sized enterprises (msmes) play an important role in China's economic development, especially in employment. Objectively speaking, we need to see that China's micro, small and medium-sized enterprises living environment and business environment has a lot of room for improvement. According to the CBRC, by the end of 2018, private enterprises accounted for only 25.8 percent of the total stock of our various types of RMB loans. In other words, private companies account for more than 80 per cent of employment and 60 per cent of GDP, but only 25.8 per cent of outstanding loans. From this point of view, the survival of msmes itself is facing a more severe test; and this epidemic is an external impact, it brings more challenges to msmes.

Professor Zhu Wuxiang's team at Tsinghua University recently conducted a survey of 995 private enterprises, which presented the problems faced by msmes in a very sharp way.

Survey results show that more than 85% of msmes, their cash flow can only sustain about 3 months, of which 1 / 3 can only sustain 1 month, 1 / 3 can sustain 2 months, visible, the cash flow situation of msmes is very tight. At the same time, the downward pressure on msmes is particularly large, the survey showed that sales revenue decline of more than 20% of the proportion of msmes accounted for 58% . In addition, enterprises also have to maintain the wages of employees, "five insurance a gold" and so on, expenditure is also facing tremendous pressure. More importantly, the survey also found that many small and medium-sized enterprises in response to the impact of the new coronavirus epidemic, the lack of good response means, basically only rely on layoffs, wage cuts, shutdowns and other means to deal with the crisis.

Therefore, when we make economic policy, the focus should be tilted, to help msmes to meet the challenges as a top priority. Although the epidemic is a command, prevention and control is the responsibility, but we also need to be clear in the understanding, to prevent economic storms is also an important part of this round of epidemic prevention and control work.

"CAIJING" : More than 40 million small and medium-sized enterprises are the basic plate of China's Economy and social stabilizer. Small and medium-sized enterprises (smes) and self-employed workers (self-employed persons) are the most vulnerable to the epidemic, which may be the greatest social challenge to date. If the epidemic spreads for another month, will there be a wave of small and medium-sized enterprises closing down?

Liu Qiao: I'm not that pessimistic. Although the impact of the epidemic on Small and medium-sized enterprises far-reaching, but we also have institutional advantages. As far as local governments are concerned, there are still a lot of policy tools at hand to help small and medium-sized enterprises to survive, and even a lot of space. However, local governments should set two goals in this process. On the one hand, they should control the spread of the epidemic as soon as possible. On the other hand, on the premise that the prevention and control of the epidemic is the primary goal, they should also resume economic and market activities as soon as possible, the economy should not be left in a state of shock for a long period of time. If this shock persists, it will not only hurt small and medium-sized enterprises, but may have an even greater impact on the overall economy.

So let us not set these two objectives in opposition, but rather restore as much economic and market activity as is suitable for recovery. Under the overall policy of the central government, governments at all levels should operate flexibly, first of all, do not "one-size-fits-all" . Try every means to reduce the operating cost of the enterprise. Second, for Small and medium-sized enterprises facing business crisis, temporary measures such as reducing or even exempting value-added tax and income tax, delaying the payment of some taxes and fees, holding over or returning some social insurance fees, and reducing or exempting rent on state-owned properties are being implemented. Thirdly, the enterprises that insist on start-up and production and do not lay off workers should be rewarded with aid and credit support.

CAIJING: the Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China said at a meeting held on February 12 that macro policy adjustments should be strengthened to study and formulate corresponding policies and measures to deal with the impact of the epidemic. What policy space do you think the central government has?

Liu Qiao: whether it is monetary policy or fiscal policy, it may be more effective to adopt structural and precise policies. In terms of monetary policy, targeted at the impact of the larger region, sub-sectors of small and medium-sized enterprises to implement targeted reduction, targeted re-lending tools. This is better than across the board rate cuts. At present, the impact of the epidemic supply, inflationary pressure, with the general decline of monetary policy, there are certain risks. I suggest that there is no need to rush into a general easing of monetary policy, such as cutting reserve requirements and interest rates. Instead, we should focus on targeted tools to achieve a precise allocation of liquidity and ensure the accurate flow of funds to the relevant sectors and regions where they are most needed, is Central to monetary policy's response to the outbreak. For example, the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission (CBRC) has issued policies to appropriately tilt credit policies towards people affected by the epidemic who have temporarily lost their sources of income, flexibly adjust personal credit repayment arrangements such as housing mortgages and credit cards, and reasonably postpone the repayment period, the Vehicle Insurance Delays "the extension does not raise the price" and so on the measure, is the accurate administrative measure.

Compared with monetary policy, fiscal policy is more targeted and precise, and counter-cyclical adjustment measures of fiscal policy can be strengthened. At present, the central government's debt ratio is not very high. Strengthening the central government's transfer payments to the local governments, increasing the issuance of government bonds, and even raising the deficit rate to 3% is the policy space. Increasing the tax and fee reductions for the larger affected industries, including reducing the enterprise income tax, value-added tax and government funds, and increasing the scope and intensity of pre-tax deductions for small and medium-sized enterprises, consider the cost of employment, rental costs of small and medium-sized enterprises, such as a certain financial subsidies.

CAIJING: recently several economists suggested that the deficit rate could be raised to 3% or even 3.5% during the national two sessions. But some scholars argue that there is little money to be made in raising the deficit ratio and that it would be better to slash government spending. This is also one of the controversial issues in the field of financial reform.

Liu Qiao: indeed, in the long run, the key is to reduce government expenditure. But an increase in the deficit from 2.8 per cent in 2019 to 3 per cent could add hundreds of billions of Renminbi to spending. It is hard to rein in spending in times of emergency, but raising the deficit ratio could solve some of the funding problems. Of course, I think, the more effective way is to issue additional treasury bonds and special debt. For example, special debts to promote the resumption of normal economic activities, and special special special debts issued by CDB, Agricultural Development Bank and other policy banks will have a more direct effect in promoting the resumption of economic activities.

Actively explore the strategy of Enterprise self-rescue

CAIJING: How can small and medium-sized enterprises save themselves from the epidemic?

Liu Qiao: For Enterprises, short-term and long-term measures are really not the same. In the short term: "survive. " During the epidemic period as far as possible to keep the cash flow of enterprises, which is the top priority for enterprises. I would like to make three specific suggestions to msmes:

First, think about what companies can do themselves, and what actions they can take to reduce the impact of the epidemic, at the basic operational, financial and capital levels. For example, at the operational level, enterprises should find ways to increase revenue and sales revenue, and can carry out online sales or some other innovative ways, and the use of extreme ways to reduce costs and rationalize the pace of investment, to alleviate the cash flow shortage of enterprises. At the financial level, you can also seek to cut interest rates, increase loans, or roll over and postpone debt in such a way as to mitigate liquidity risk and avoid business failure.

Second, the government has a lot of room for manoeuvre at the policy level, and enterprises should actively seek the government's support. Local governments have recently introduced a large number of policies, and the focus of these policies are also related to helping micro, small and medium enterprises, such as tax relief or holdover and so on. Therefore, entrepreneurs should pay close attention to government initiatives, watch more news broadcasts, learn more about local government policies, and seek government support and help.

Third, the enterprise should carry on the omni-directional coordination and the communication with the stakeholder. In such extreme cases, the enterprise should coordinate and communicate with its stakeholders, including employees, upstream and downstream, financiers and investors, as well as customers, and seek understanding from all parties, find a symbiotic way to get through this.

CAIJING: What can enterprises do to seek the understanding of stakeholders?

Liu Qiao: at the enterprise level, I think the mutual cooperation and support between enterprises is very important. The special period needs to display the enterprise's symbiosis and mutual benefit spirit, like this can walk out the difficult position together. We note that some banks have cut interest rates on industries affected by the outbreak, delaying the delivery of principal and interest; some city commercial banks have adjusted interest rates to reduce the cost of credit for enterprises; and Wanda Group has announced rent-free rent for the merchants in Wanda Plaza, hema Xiansheng temporary use of the food and beverage enterprises affected by the epidemic staff and other cross-border, cross-enterprise cooperation attempt. This spirit of symbiosis and sharing is a country an economy to a certain stage after the emergence of enterprises more dependent on the market, relying on the embodiment of symbiotic strength of the industry.

On the other hand, for China's private enterprises, or small and medium-sized enterprises, the epidemic has also accelerated the process of differentiation of Chinese enterprises. Companies with a symbiotic and shared philosophy in the epidemic; companies with sophisticated operations and active responses; companies that are sensitive to new market opportunities and seize them in a timely manner; and companies that face uncertainty, companies that have the flexibility to adapt their management and organisation may emerge. Some enterprises with insufficient strength, inadequate response and limited space may be eliminated under the impact of the epidemic.

"CAIJING" : that is to say, between the upper and lower reaches of the industry, between the industrial chain, between the relevant enterprises through a certain degree of transfer, sharing to maintain the entire industrial chain of good operation, because of symbiosis and survival.

Liu Qiao: It's more accurate to say that. In fact, this matter is of great value. There are more and more socially responsible enterprises in Chinese enterprises, and the power of this positive orientation is gradually converging. It is a social or industrial force outside the government, and the full release of this force will help enterprises to face the economic challenges brought by the epidemic together. I think real CSR is rooted in the business model, and the value of synergy and symbiosis in the industrial chain will play a bigger and bigger role.

CAIJING: improving business models is also a way for companies to save themselves. The outbreak has prompted many companies to experiment with online-to-offline integration, telecommuting, virtual socializing and more.

Liu Qiao: The epidemic is indeed changing the business model of enterprises, some enterprises seize the changes in time, adapt to changes, homeopathy. To a certain extent, the epidemic will accelerate the trend of enterprise transformation and upgrading, and enterprises that can survive or even grow better must be more agile, refined and innovation-driven. Telecommuting, the rise of online projects, drone operations, and so on, are all ways for businesses to save themselves and ensure their survival. These things may not have an immediate effect on large businesses, but in the long run is the embodiment of the process of enterprise differentiation.

"CAIJING" : As you said, the economic impact of the epidemic can not be ignored, "we really feel the storm in the storm. How did the second half of the war respond to the economic storm that followed?

Liu Qiao: Premier Li Keqiang chaired a meeting of the China State Council executive meeting on February 11, advocating that while doing everything possible to prevent and control the epidemic, economic operation and regulation should be strengthened to ensure an orderly resumption of production and life order, promoting enterprises to resume work and production in an orderly manner. This direction is very important. The challenge we face is twofold: on the one hand, the prevention and control of the epidemic is urgent. "The epidemic is a command and prevention and control is a responsibility, " Xi said. "The prevention and control of the spread of the epidemic is of paramount importance and overriding importance. ". On the other hand, the economic storm caused by the epidemic. I think it is very important for local governments to view the prevention and control of the epidemic in a scientific and rational way. Instead of opposing these two goals, local governments should try to restore as much economic and market activity as is appropriate for recovery. At the same time, the local government in the formulation of policies to avoid some excessive intervention, excessive policy, do not let the enterprise's operating costs increase.

To prevent and control the epidemic while respecting market rules, gradually resume market activities and enhance the ability and resilience of the market to deal with emergencies is also an important sign of the continuous improvement of the country's comprehensive management capacity. At present, it can be seen that there are differences in law enforcement activities, economic activities, prevention and control of the epidemic, as well as differences in the ability to govern.

A test of local governance

"CAIJING" : At present, some cities have already started the policy of benefiting enterprises, such as Macao, Suzhou, Ningbo and so on, to provide interest-free loans to smes and other measures. How would you rate the performance of the local government for more than a month?

Liu Qiao: the absence of hair will be attached. If there is a wave of business failures, the impact on the local economy will be more severe. Therefore, some local governments to introduce measures such as burden reduction for small and medium-sized enterprises is very sensible. In the case of prevention and control of the spread of the epidemic, the government may have to play a certain role in reviving economic vitality, the government has some guiding and encouraging policies to encourage enterprises to face the epidemic together. At present, we see 13 policies to ease the difficulties of smes in Sichuan, 16 measures to promote the development of smes in Beijing, and 17 measures to support smes in Zhejiang Shanghai and Guangzhou have introduced measures to ensure the normal operation of enterprises, and implemented policies to reduce the burden of unemployment insurance, such as stabilizing posts and returning jobs.

I think these local governments'practices are worth summarizing and popularizing. For example, for enterprises that do not lay off workers or reduce their number of employees, unemployment insurance will give some back to the enterprises. There are flexible arrangements for the payment of five kinds of insurance, one gold, or value-added tax and income tax. Even state-owned capital can play a role. Through this emergency way, so that msmes can continue to operate. These emergency measures, institutional arrangements, reflect the local government in response to major emergencies, governance capacity.

CAIJING: In order to prevent the spread of the epidemic, some places have cut off logistics, human flow, road closure, road closure, city closure, people closure, etc. ?

Liu Qiao: Public Crisis Emergency Management should avoid "single dimension" guidance. I still emphasize two dimensions, the first is to prevent the spread of the epidemic. The second dimension is to restore production and employment as much as possible. Take a scientific and reasonable way to return to work, but also to the local government policy-making capacity, governance capacity test. During this period, some places adopted the practice of filling out forms, registering "epidemic prevention" and other formalism and bureaucracy. Some local governments, in violation of the principle of "prevention and control in accordance with the law, in a scientific and orderly manner" , have taken extreme measures to combat the epidemic in an absolute, simple and one-size-fits-all manner, even causing new disasters. For example, "one-size-fits-all" persuasion to foreign vehicles and personnel; logistics restrictions, production of raw materials can not be delivered in time, workers can not return to work as soon as possible, transportation disruption, and so on, I am more worried that this piece of chain impact will be a bit larger.

CAIJING: At the Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China meeting on February 3, it was stressed that in the work of epidemic prevention and control, we must resolutely oppose the formalism and bureaucracy, as well as those who dare not take responsibility, have a loose style, and shirk their responsibilities, and resolutely hold them accountable. It also said the outbreak was a test for China's governance system.

Liu Qiao: I think the local government should avoid excessive intervention and adopt some policies that are too excessive. We should respect the market rules and gradually resume market activities. Still must believe the market as far as possible, consummates the market movement mechanism, enhances the market to deal with the unexpected event the ability and the resilience. This is itself the Third Plenary Session of the 18th Central Committee, let the market in economic activities, the allocation of resources play a decisive role in the demand reflected.

In this emergency situation, local governments need to make it clear that there is a balance between prevention and control of the epidemic and dealing with the economic storm. Consider the use of government mechanisms to restore normal economic activity, play the market response to such emergencies. From this point of view, I suggest that the transport, postal, express delivery, supermarkets and retail industries, or the need to find a way to scientifically restore operation, to ensure that the transport of goods and people's lives are not affected. It should be said that the local government in the fight against the epidemic, handed over a different paper.

The governance capacity of local governments determines the level of modernization of the country's governance system and governance capacity. The Fourth Plenary Session of the 19th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China proposed to promote the modernization of the national governance system and governance capacity in an all-round way, and regard it as the general goal of overall deepening reform. At present, China's government performance evaluation has formed a new performance management model and performance evaluation framework. To enhance the market's ability and resilience in dealing with unexpected events is an important sign of the continuous improvement of a country's comprehensive governance capacity.

It is not easy to prevent and control the epidemic. It is relatively easy to do it at all costs and at all costs. It is also easy to do it in a way that does not pay attention to methods and does not pay attention to scientific rationality. But it is also easy to do the work in accordance with the Scientific Outlook on Development and the concept of scientific development, it is not easy to have a sincere sense of "serving the people" . At present already saw the difference which each local government deals with, sees each local ruling political administration ability difference.

"CAIJING" : This epidemic is actually a big test of China's governance system and capacity, in the face of the epidemic exposed some of the problems and institutional constraints, as well as the government's ability to deal with the disaster is a test.

Liu Qiao: I couldn't agree more. In fact, the modernization of the system of state governance must be emphasized when the Chinese economy reaches the stage of high-quality development.

At a time when national governance capacity is becoming more scientific, epidemics also help us to find weaknesses and shortcomings. In fact, the attitude adopted by local governments in dealing with the epidemic, the accuracy and effectiveness of the implementation of policies, whether to take into account the feelings of the people and other local differences are very obvious. So I think, in the past, the Chinese development model emphasized the GDP competition among local governments. In the process of implementing the new development concept, coupled with the supervision pressure from outside public opinion, local governments have already turned to this kind of social governance capability, the race for scientific governance has shifted.

Since the media, public opinion, the approval or criticism of the local government has played a supervisory role, the evaluation of local government dimensions have undergone some fundamental changes. It is a good thing that local government policies are more sensitive to public opinion than they used to be. This epidemic storm will eventually subside, but it reflects some changes, to provide us with experience and lessons, more conducive to a country's economic transformation, social governance transformation. I think maybe this outbreak will lead to a "growth tournament" among local governments that will slowly shift to a "public governance tournament" focused on governance. Let's hope this outbreak is a turning point in the transition.

Read more about the outbreak in pictures
